department.ch: 工業管理研究所碩士班

goal.ch:
“ Learn how to organize multivariate data and identify situations where multivariate analysis is necessary and beneficial.
 Learn the terminology and mathematical notation used to describe multivariate techniques.
 Learn how to use computer software for multivariate methods
 Learn how to self-learn a particular topic with guided materials, and share and present it to the class.
 Maybe sparkle the interested research with some introduced ideas/topics in the class.“
goal.en:
“ Learn how to organize multivariate data and identify situations where multivariate analysis is necessary and beneficial.
 Learn the terminology and mathematical notation used to describe multivariate techniques.
 Learn how to use computer software for multivariate methods
 Learn how to self-learn a particular topic with guided materials, and share and present it to the class.
 Maybe sparkle the interested research with some introduced ideas/topics in the class.“

outline.ch:
“This course consists of two parts of methodology, multivariate analysis and data mining. Successful applications of these models require a sound understanding of both the underlying theory and the practical problems that are encountered in using the models in real-life situation. In this course, theoretical ideas are presented to the degree needed for good understanding in making sound application. If students feel interested in some certain topics and want to study further, they know where to find the advance materials. In other words, this course provides students a broad view of methodologies which are useful to their research and future professional works. Application of these methodologies/models frequently require extensive computations, which will be carried out by statistical software like Excel, Minitab, SAS, or Python. The course includes the following topics:
1. Introduction to Multivariate Analysis: Multivariate Test, Linear Models, Classification and Clustering
2. Introduction to Data Mining: Decision Trees, Baysian Network, Association Rules, and etc.“
outline.en:
“This course consists of two parts of methodology, multivariate analysis and data mining. Successful applications of these models require a sound understanding of both the underlying theory and the practical problems that are encountered in using the models in real-life situation. In this course, theoretical ideas are presented to the degree needed for good understanding in making sound application. If students feel interested in some certain topics and want to study further, they know where to find the advance materials. In other words, this course provides students a broad view of methodologies which are useful to their research and future professional works. Application of these methodologies/models frequently require extensive computations, which will be carried out by statistical software like Excel, Minitab, SAS, or Python. The course includes the following topics:
1. Introduction to Multivariate Analysis: Multivariate Test, Linear Models, Classification and Clustering
2. Introduction to Data Mining: Decision Trees, Baysian Network, Association Rules, and etc.“

textbook.ch:
“Applied Linear Regression Models (4th Edition),
  by M. H. Kutner, C. J. Nachtsheim, and J. Neter 
 Applied Multivariare Statistical Analysis, 
  by R. A. Johnson and D. W. Wichern
 Data Mining,  by Jiawei Han and M. Kamber“
textbook.en:
“Applied Linear Regression Models (4th Edition),
  by M. H. Kutner, C. J. Nachtsheim, and J. Neter 
 Applied Multivariare Statistical Analysis, 
  by R. A. Johnson and D. W. Wichern
 Data Mining,  by Jiawei Han and M. Kamber“

gradMethod.ch:
“Project   30％
 Practicing Report and Attendance 20％
 Midterm Examination 25％
 Final Examination  25％“
gradMethod.en:
“Project   30％
 Practicing Report and Attendance 20％
 Midterm Examination 25％
 Final Examination  25％“

flexDiscription.ch: 針對期末專題進行後續改進
flexDiscription.en: Continue to work with students to refine their projects.

ch.competencies: 獨立思考和解決問題能力

ch: 系所:限工業管理研究所碩士班。年級:限一年級。
en: Department:Master of Industrial Management only.Year:First Year only.
